div.pre: 159 Phayttus, near Tricca, Thessaly, c. 1956 Burial: c. 264 B.C. (Franke); 260-240 (Va- roucha) Contents: 61 AR, 4 AE. Pot hoard Alexander III: 7 early and late post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 2, Pella 2,Lamp- sacus 1, Priene 1, Aradus 1) 26 dr. (chiefly Asia Minor mints) Philip III: 1 dr. (Lampsacus) Demetrius Poliorcetes: 1 tetradr. (Pella, Newell 80) Antigonus Gonatas: 2 tetradr.; 4 AE Lysimachus: 3 tetradr. (Lampsacus 2) Lamia: 1 hemidr. Oetaei: 1 hemidr. Locris: 2 hemidr. Boeotia: 2 st. Histiaea: 2 tetrob. Athens: 8 tetradr. Sicyon: 3 st. Seleucus I: 1 tetradr. (Seleuceia Pieria as WSM 890) Antiochus I: 1 dr. (Bactra as ESM 698) Disposition: Volos 50; Athens 4 coins, 11 casts Varoucha, BCH 1957, pp. 497-8, illus. (4 coins) Franke, AA 1958, pp. 38-62, illus. The two lots would seem to belong to the same hd. Whether the burial can be as early as the mid third century will depend on the date of the Histiaea coins, if they were part of the original deposit
